CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 28, 1950, pg. 13, reads: "Diamond Market Gives Prizes - While the large crowd of customers, pictured in top photo, looked on Tuesday night, with such well-known figures as B. B. McGinnis and Jackie Heller in attendance, Diamond Market selected the four persons above, a Negro woman, two white women and a man, as judges and proceeded to give away a Plymouth Sedan, a television set and a refrigerator. Receiving the car were Mr. and Mrs. William Dyeson and the refrigerator, Mrs. Tjechman, 211 Fifty-seventh Street. Mrs. Carl Beatty, 751 McNeilley Road, got the television set. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Men and women crowding around meat counters at the New Diamond Market with balloons and sign promoting a 1950 Plymouth sedan drawing
